abstract: New York State Justice Daniel P Conviser overturns criminal conviction of Sergey Aleynikov, former Goldman Sachs programmers who was convicted of stealing confidential computer code from company's high speed trading business; prosecutors say they may purse appeal; it is second time that Aleynikov has had conviction related to case overturned, and previous instance occurred at federal level.
lead_paragraph: The ruling sets the stage for state prosecutors to either appeal the decision or let Sergey Aleynikov’s six-year legal odyssey through the courts come to an end.

headline.main: Conviction of Former Goldman Sachs Programmer Is Overturned
headline.print_headline: Ex-Goldman Programmer’s Conviction Is Overturned, Again

snippet: The ruling sets the stage for state prosecutors to either appeal the decision or let Sergey Aleynikov’s six-year legal odyssey through the courts come to an end.
